Key Match Events: Brandon Miller scored off an offensive rebound at the buzzer to lift Charlotte Hornets to a thrilling 108-107 victory over the Detroit Pistons
Miles Bridges had 27 points and LaMelo Ball added 25 points on five 3-pointers for the Hornets
Cade Cunningham had a triple-double for Detroit with 20 points, 10 rebounds and 10 assists
Ronald Holland picked up the loose ball and drove from halfcourt for a go-ahead layup with 6.3 seconds left to give the Pistons the lead
Post-Match Reflections: The Hornets snapped a three-game losing streak
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hornets came into the season figuring the bulk of their scoring would come from Ball, Miller and Bridges, and for the first time this season all three put up good numbers together
Others: Jalen Duren left the game in the first quarter with an ankle injury and did not return
